author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1684450740}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Straima is a game developed and published by caiys

The game offers some nice graphics and a beautiful aesthetic which is pleasant all the same and has some amazing attention to detail even though it is a little rough around the edges

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless and ends just at the right time

Straima overall, however, is a fun game to play, yet sometimes repetitive and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a good platformer game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]
[*] None

author: {'steamid': '76561198301054106', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1677908430}
review: The first of caisy's s-type games and it's not even a roguelite. It's a platformer and I am surprised at how much I enjoyed this as I'm not much of a platformer guy.The graphics are a ton of fun and knowing that most of the enemies and powers from Immortaly are ported straight from this game is one part interesting[they are integrated into the second game very well] but also [slightly] reduces the latter game's uniqueness. The levels are confined to a single screen which limits the frustration factor very well as most levels can be completed in under a minute. 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047720356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1635372886}
review:
I really wasn't enjoying this, so I masochistically pushed through to 100% completion. I did every level getting the deathless requirement and the time requirement at the same time, not realising I could do them in 2 separate runs until later. My biggest problem with the game is the lack of explanation for what's going on, and the rare requirement for very specific moves. A level around 70% of the way through requires you to throw boxes directly beneath you by pressing down while holding one, something that might be taught in the tutorial but this was the first and only time you needed to do it in the game. A level right at the end left me completely stumped as to how you reached the targets in the top corners, until I remembered you could grab ledges (this was the only level I ever needed to, and it was so awkward to pull off I never used it elsewhere). There's a couple other mechanics specific to single levels that are never taught and never used again, which is terrible design.

Another major gripe is how player-unfriendly the game is. If you jump a pixel too late off of a platform, it'll use your double jump and you'll die. It's impossible to push a box off a ledge consistently because the second it's off the ledge it gains a hitbox and kills you. There are blue platforms you can dive down through, except this is fiddly and trying to dive and LAND on a blue platform will almost certainly end in an unfair death. If these had been replaced with forgiving, in favour of the player game logic, the game would have been a LOT more enjoyable.

For a solo-dev first game the visuals, music and honestly the game overall is impressive, but there's just so many blunders I wouldn't recommend it. Anyway, onto the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053313570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1634342443}
review:
Really cool game. A modern simple classic. Has a fun sense of humor.

Played with friends for a couple worlds without issue, then went back to the game a year later and the game crashed several times for us. We were using 2 xbox 360 controllers and 1 newer xbox bluetooth controller that was directly connected via USB as well. At seemingly random spots, an abort error would pop up saying things like missing spawn animation. I will try to replicate it and get a screenshot.
developer_response: Hi. Not sure what issue you're having. Is it possible for you to take a screenshot of the error message or copy-paste it into a forum post?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000664277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1592313433}
review:
Fun single room platformer with a neat art direction and an amazing chiptune soundtrack.
While challenging it never felt unfair or impossible which paired with the short length of the levels gave me that "one more try" feeling.
Also has a randomly generated infinite runner mode and some multiplayer modes.
Definitely recommended if you like the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968285815', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1656374191}
review:
Hardcore platform action. 

Unique art style. If it is too distracting, there are options to tame the graphics to optimise gameplay.

Lots of modes (main, level editor, infinite runner, multiplayer modes).

Like all Caiysware games, this one packs a lot of content in a low low price.

Highly recommended if you are into challenging games that require a decent level of patience to get good at.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999610114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1595816864}
review:
Straima seems like it ought to be off-putting. That cute-grotesque style of sprite art, the trademark babble diction used when the game occasionally bothers to explain something, all the oddball mechanics. It's probably just me, but I find it cozy. It's a comfy platformer, enough so to make me come back and keep exploring the map and earning time/no-death medals after reaching the end.

Plenty of levels here have powerful WTO energy: "what the... oh!" A level can look unfair at first glance, but some prodding and consideration reveals a strategy or a path through the nonsense. Straima has substantially over a hundred single-screen levels, each distinctive and providing a unique sort of challenge.

Though self-described as "difficult," Straima is on the forgiving end of this style of platformer. You've got a per-level life limit to squish all the pinkies on the screen, and squished pinkies stay gone when you respawn. Stuck on a level? Head elsewhere on the branching world map, and you might find a helpful power-up or life-up, or a different path to your goal.

I had some frustrations early on when some mechanics didn't behave how I expected. But it only took some observation and experimentation to get into the groove. It's a good groove, not much like anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135630024', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1660048528}

author: {'steamid': '76561198317395317', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1130, 'last_played': 1709581608}
review:
Модификация на темноту, лабиринт, я пытаюсь найти пинки чтобы их убить своими ногами, в итоге на вас бежит красный гуманоид и вас убивает.  У вас ещё вторая жизнь, вы пытаетесь снова найти пинки которые остали... вас убила красная маска. У вас осталась одна жизнь, вы используете абилку и проходите сквозь блоки..... и попадаете на чертовы шипы. 

Все таки уровни хоть и сложные, но проходимы, если стараться. 
Графика в пикселях как я люблю, крутой саундтрек на который я подсел , разнообразие врагов и механика, а также креатор уровней.

Я прошел всю игру, создал много уровней, развиваю свои навыки в креаторе до сих пор. 
Скоро буду копить на Straimium Immortaly. 

Я рекомендую эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024793242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1552358095}
review:
Straima is a small indie platformer that offers fast-paced and challenging action, but some of the difficulty comes from undesired places. Many have commented on the frustrating low-gravity 'floaty' feel of the game. Perhaps the biggest issue with Straima is that its unique visual design is blinding and uncomfortable to look at for long periods, albeit brilliant and deeply creative.

I give great credit to the developer for continuing to update and polish the game according to feedback from the community. I will probably give Straima another try in the future. However, I can't recommend this game within the packed platformer genre right now. I paid $2.43 for Straima on sale, and I wouldn't recommend it at that price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059789150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1946, 'last_played': 1637494457}
review:
Frustrating but addicting. The gameplay is really intense, so I ended up playing it in short, frequent sessions. You can also jump into the Room Reviser (i.e. level editor) for a relaxing break.

The game doesn't really have a specific gimmick that defines gameplay, but it holds up fine using just good, mostly generic controls and great levels.

Somehow the player character is really endearing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151949555', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1550336738}
review:
[h1]Straima Review[/h1]

SO I just finished Straima, an indie platforming game that has 1-4 players, and I've finished it 100%, having nothing but fun.

[h1]Initial Reaction/Gameplay/Overall Experience[/h1]
When I first got into it, I had little no idea what the fuck was going on, though I quickly learned you just need to hunt down pink creatures to destroy as well as recieve no deaths and finish the par time to 'goldify' a level. If you are a completionist (or an aspiring completionist) like me, this gets very addicting! The satisfaction that came from finally clearing all the 90 levels is unmatched.

[h1]The Graphics[/h1]
I have no doubt there had to be at least some kind of drugs involved in the design process itself. The game's overall design is pretty good in my view, and nice to look at. Be advised, some people might think it's very hard on the eyes and may look confusing - though I personally very much liked it, sprite design was real good.

[b]It was a game that was simple at times and difficult at times, and it was a wild ride.[/b]


P.S. The developer is pretty nice and very responsive, I was having immense trouble with the last level I needed to beat, and he very much helped me out

author: {'steamid': '76561197972202664', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1524905139}
review:
Somebody concisely described Straima as Super Meat Boy on LSD, but I think it's also more than that. 

It's an aesthetic fever-dream, but it's functionally very similar to other platformers:  You navigate a map for each of the 5 worlds (not unlike a classic Super Mario map), unlocking paths by beating levels; there are also multiple ways to reach the boss at the end of each world without completing every level.  There are even roaming "enemies" on each of the world maps, and you'll be forced into a mini-game if you cross paths with one of them.

Don't be fooled by the initial levels (which are deceptively easy)--before its end, Straima ramps up the difficulty with harder enemies, obstacles, and novel level design.  Fortunately, you'll unlock additional items and abilities as you get further into the game, so if you find yourself hitting a "brick wall" on a particular level, you can usually try different strategies in overcoming a tough map.  Additionally, the game never reaches the extreme difficulties of, say, Super Meat Boy's harder zones.

Regardless, the fundamental goal always remains the same every level:  Stomp the shit out of every "pinky" (a little pink glob) in sight.  Sometimes that will be done in a room with low-gravity.  Sometimes that will be done in a dark maze filled with traps.  Sometimes that might even be done while being chased by enemies who freeze as long as you look at them.  But the objective will [i]always[/i] focus on destroying those helpless, weird little globs.

Items include consumables that allow you to "clear" a level without actually beating it (useful for particularly troublesome maps); abilities include the option of temporarily turning invisible, destroying all projectiles around you, and melting through solid floors.  Not all of these items and abilities are created equal, however, and several of them will likely sit in your menus, untouched.

Mechanically, Straima definitely sits on the slower, floatier side of platformers.  Whereas a game like Super Meat Boy has tight, responsive controls, the player moves ponderously in Straima.  I suppose it gives it that "slowly trying to run away in a nightmare" feeling, but I still wish the game was more responsive.

Overall, Straima seems to be a solid option for somebody who likes platformers, but still wants something a little novel.  A little strange.  It's not a perfect game by any means, but at its price point (and especially if it's on sale), fans of platformers will likely find some enjoyment in its ~100 increasingly weird levels.



[b]PROS:[/b]
+ Excellent difficulty curve, with a fair number of options to help players progress (like taking an alternative path on the world map, or using limited consumable items to clear levels) with minimal frustation
+ Consumable items and optional abilities give you more options on how to approach a level...although they're not all equally useful 
+ The implementation of both Co-op [i]and[/i] Level Editor features are not something you often see in these types of games


[b]CONS:[/b]
- I got used to the player physics, but I never really [i]liked[/i] them--they're too floaty and lethargic, like I'm swimming through the air.  
- This game has one of the worst, clunkiest "wall jump" maneuvers of any platformer I've played in recent years; it's a liability more than an asset, and I wish it worked more similarly to games like DYE or Super Meat Boy

author: {'steamid': '76561197966511621', 'num_games_owned': 1216, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1522105563}
review: I don't care for platformers, especially not hard ones, but i would definitely recommend Straima to people who do. It's weird and quirky in a good way, and all the bizarre descriptions crack me up. There is just one huge flaw. The tutorial doesn't actually explain the goal of the game. So i was trying to get to the "end" of the level, since that's how it usually works. Not here. Maybe add a line about having to squish all the pink things somewhere in the tutorial?

author: {'steamid': '76561198061666946', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1522869665}
review:
What in the world was the graphics team thinking? I never had this much head ache playing the Virtual Boy, but this has my eyes going on strike against me for terrible working conditions. 

I don't know if you can find enjoyment getting past these visuals – I sure can't – and I believe some kind of warning is warranted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288692181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1571769337}
review:
This is a really fun and unique hardcore platformer. It has several different modes, all of which are great (at least I assume the multiplayer stuff is great), and some really interesting concepts in its levels. And you can use ALL of them in the level editor!

Remember your ledge-grab and wall-jump. Also remember that grabbing ledges restores your double-jump, and a jump from a ledge-grab works like a wall-jump, except that wall-jumps do not restore your double-jump, meaning that if you have already double-jumped since the last time you touched the ground, you can not double-jump from a wall like you could from a grabbed ledge. Also remember that double jumps (and stomps) undo unwanted vertical momentum should something try to rocket you into an unhealthy dose of die. Also remember that a few stages give you extra, and sometimes infinite, mid-air jumps, as indicated on your power-select screen, which also indicates when there's low gravity. And note that there's a lot more to this game than just jumping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032725051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1518807600}
review:
Edit: The developer has reached out to me and is very helpful, so be sure to read the comments under this review.

The menu is quite unreadable. I'm pretty sure I got stuck in the tutorial, because when I did the same thing again later it magically worked, maybe the enemies are just hard to read against the wonky backgrounds.
I'll give it a second chance later, but I'm disappointed for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119598306', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1516047160}
review: Delightful game. The graphic design looks great on screenshots but really comes alive while playing. So many different levels with a great variety of mechanics, fun enemies. Precision platformers tend to be samey, but this game explodes with ideas. Only a handful of levels I didn't like but even those had something unique about them. And then there were the eye-watering frustration on some of the screens. There is some straight up spiteful obstacle-placement. But all levels can be optimized and executed perfectly because the engine is solid.  Loved the adventure mode forcing me to rank well on some levels, the freeplay to learn the hardest levels and the infinite runner is a cool addition. This game really deserves 10 times the players than it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993681861', 'num_games_owned': 2141, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1658090504}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978514254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1480260922}
review: Franchement trop chelou... j'ai pas vraiment compris l'intérêt de ce jeu.. Et puis vue que c'est quand même un peu moche et confus, difficile de faire jouer des potes...

author: {'steamid': '76561197997370410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1592115751}
review:
This is a really fantastic platformer.

The music is addictive.

The artwork is fun and chaotic. Especially when you first play it is thoroughly confusing, and you may miss enemies or pink blobs because of the background.

The level design is great, if at times a bit random, and the 3 modes are all really nice. You die a lot and restart immediately, the levels are short. You just learn as you go, for instance, quickly discovering that red is bad and purple is good. It's quirky and difficult - the controls are great so I generally feel like it's my own fault when I die. But it's also somewhat random, so you have to react fast.

Both this and Straimium Immortaly are a blast, and have excellent replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064165453', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1600428735}
review:
Геймплей в Straima сводится к уничтожению на экране фиолетовых существ похожих на слизней, при этом игроку постоянно мешают разнообразные противники и ловушки. Для усиления персонажа перед началом каждого уровня доступен выбор абилки, которая влияет на стиль прохождения.
Из минусов игры можно отметить разве что однообразную музыку.
Straima это качественный платформер с простой, но красивой пиксельной графикой и довольно высокой сложностью.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938346', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 558, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1667275408}
review:
Buy this game.

A great combination of platformer, speed runner, and puzzle.  Yes puzzle.

This game hearkens back to the days of C64 games like Jumpman, Lode Runner, 

Very hard, but completely fair.  I don't even get upset when I die and have to restart the map run again because I often see different routes as I push my way through and try to figure out the best way.

What I find when I play is that I always feel that victory is just in sight if I adapt my skill or play a little.  As a result Straima pushes me to be a better gamer.

I love this game so much but it is super-intense and I can only take it in short bursts.

My biggest criticism, not really a criticism just a reality is that due to the pixel nature of the graphics and perhaps my age, I find it very hard to play on screens that aren't right in front of my face.  I can't play this on my 50" TV with my Steam Link because I can't see anything.  Sitting in front of my PC monitor, no problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104465063', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1493003289}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025253997', 'num_games_owned': 1442, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1491012475}
review:
Edited review: I complained about some features of this game, and the dev actually reached out and made some changes to the game based on my feedback! Very cool. Original review below with the conversation thread for context. A fan of a developer that cares about their audience! Be warned though: This game has a big learning curve, and is VERY hard!

Original review below:  While I enjoyed the idea of this game, the controls were not precise enough to accomplish the tasks it was asking you to do.  It did not strike a balance between challenging and fair, you were often left feeling that the deaths were the fault of the control scheme and lack of movement options rather than your own failings. Play N++ or Super Meat Boy instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001240991', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1584314142}
review: Give this game a chance it warms up on you really fast. At first it can be next to impossible to figure out what is going on but that became one of best things about it a few minutes in. Also recomend playing this with a friend. Dev is also really involved with the game and thats a huge plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033038078', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1484375243}
review: Definitely not for everyone. If you like dying repeatedly and don't mind if the game intentionally makes dangerous things and goal objects difficult to discern, this game is great fun. And it's multiplayer in every mode, so that's awesome. So if you have one to three friends nearby that are hardcore like you, get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037455247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1480600207}
review: 这个游戏能让你想起所有8位机时代的美好时光, 这里不是指那些8位机的车枪球, 而是8位机的猫捉老鼠之类的又去的跳跃平台的游戏.游戏为玩家提供了不同的能力, 比如穿地板,超高跳跃, 所有能力的使用依赖于于CD回复,游戏故事大概讲述了一个超越空间的"神",她饿了, 于是放出了她的忍者帮她清楚各种粉红色的小怪物.好吧,具体是不是她饿了我不太确定.因为故事设定在超越空间时间的理念里, 于是场景有了诸多变化,比如无限的优先空间, 你往空间下面跳会回到空间的上层,比如空间,顶部与底部都是岩浆.相信对于手残党或者习惯FPS的玩家,这个游戏的难度不仅仅是难, 是很难, 她要求你对时机,对环境,敌人AI走位都要有深刻的把控才能过去.开始玩一定注意初始能力是穿地板, 很好玩.很虐, 但一旦你掌握了敌人的行为模式, 掌握了这关的最佳路线, 一名通关的且快速的通关的感觉很棒.为了游戏性,为了奇怪的设定,为了8 bit艺术,为了动听的8bit\音乐,推荐!

author: {'steamid': '76561198128418462', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1476563173}
review: ce jeu me faisait pensait a un autre jeu semblable que j'avais eu sur pc, du nom de load runner (pour ceux que ça parle) il contient un mode aventure, un editeur de niveau et autre mode bien sympathique. cela m'a intriguer bien evidament, et qu'esce que j'en ai penser des les 20 premiere minute? bah déjà que le faite de ne pas comprendre trop l'anglais ne m'a pas vraiment aider a comprendre le gameplay du jeu ^^" mais c'est passer :3 ducoup je trouve le gamplay, unique et plutot bizarre. mais voyez- vous meme l'ambiance du jeu est bizarre! la bande son est bonne et colle tres bien a cela! un monde psychiedelique avec une music et un gameplay qui suit l'étrangeter. sinon comme vous avez sans doute remarquer, c'est tres pixeliser, mais c'est du pixel art magistralement bien fait! au final ce jeu est une bonne surprise! et comme avec mon jeu d'antan, il se joue a plusieurs en co-op local! que de souvenir! :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198067683201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1291, 'last_played': 1518152251}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009661980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1467069629}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117395571', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1665378373}
review: This is an amazing platforming game with over 100 super hard levels, an amazing level editor, and great local multiplayer fun! its worth the $7.99. This games visuals and graphics (are those the same thing????, eh whatever) are stunningly beautiful, and ive had fun just making structures and testing this games graphics. another added bonus, this games developer "caiysware" is active around the discussions page and helped me out with one of the problems ive found with the game (the problem wasnt a glitch, it was instead a fault of windows 7 beig dumb, so far i dont think ive found an actual glitch in this game yet :D ) buy it now, on steamsies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986529486', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1457818290}
review: Very psychedelic and visually interesting controller shooty game with tight gameplay. Cool developer too, genuinely interested in making their game good. Since I first reviewed it my man has added a ton of cool stuff to the game. Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078806318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1651638247}
review:
I was gonna make a joke about drugs but I guess I'll just do a simple pros/cons list because this game deserves it.

Pros:
Simple yet deep gameplay
Good level design
Unique powers 
Lots of levels
Good replayability
Difficult, but only if trying to achieve target time and get 0 deaths. Otherwise, it can be a casual puzzle-platformer
Local co-op (2 players)
Local deathmatch (Up to 4 players)
Pink blobs that explode into memes upon death
Slang text which somehow makes you smile 
Level editor
Runs on a potato
Better than drugs (I had to)

Cons:
Idk

11/10

review: The game looks interesting, but it lags tremendously on my computer even with the effects disabled, so I can't really say either way. Since it doesn't seem to be common and the developer is responding helpfully I'll give it the thumbs up anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179862677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1446328847}
review: It's okay. The developer responds nicely to comments, and gameplay is solid. The only thing that needs improvment is the tutorial. It is a bit confusing and odd. Game was not for me though. Played it with a sibling of mine and we didn't understand what to do. Other people might like this game though, but if psycedelic colours aren't your thing, don't buy this. If you have elipisey, don't get this. I didn't like this title much, but appreciated Anthony Case's try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081836126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1444521292}
review:
This game is more complex and challenging than first meets the eye. The more I played the more I began to appreciate just how much depth you can give a pixel graphic game.

Very colourful but not hard on the eyes. I was lukewarm on the music but I've never been a fan of that kind of cyber techno soundtrack. I believe it is an acquired taste.

I didn't try the multiplayer but I can see where that would be fun.

I don't know that I would ever pay the full current price for it but when on sale, or in a bundle, it's a very decent addition to anyone's collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036117725', 'num_games_owned': 6808, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1544263945}
review:
At first I was put off that Straima had multiplayer with up to four players and imagined that the game was built around that and would offer a subpar single-player experience; I was wrong.

Straima is an extremely difficult platformer set up with over 100 bite-sized stages. Each stage consists of a single, non-scrolling map that loops on each side. Focusing on a small space allows the level design to be very meaningful and not filled with fluff.  A few stages even offer nods to other games such as Tetris, Frogger, or VVVVV. The main goal for each stage is to squash every pink blob (pinkie) on the screen. There are also two side-goals for each stage; finish within a certain time and/or without dying. The game tracks your progress for the side-goals in the form of gold trophies next to the level on the menu and these goals can be met on separate runs. Most stages have a target time between 20-60 seconds. One might think that this is worrying for game length, but Straima offers excellent replayability.

The game can be rather addicting when it comes to completing a stage under the par time. There were many occasions where I was only a few seconds away from reaching it and couldn't walk away while thinking “I'll get it on the next try!”. Of course, the run I was looking for was sometimes a dozen or two attempts away. Though, there were times when I was stuck on certain levels (I'm looking at you, Pinball Wiz) and needed to move on to another. The great thing about Straima is that there are so many levels to choose from that this isn't an issue. As you play other stages, you will learn certain tricks that might allow you to shave off a few seconds from previous levels that the target time was just a hair out of reach. At times, Straima even felt like a puzzle game to me. I would sit here and map out my route, trying to finish the level in the quickest way possible. The time trials can be rather tight even if you don't die in a level which makes this planning very necessary. There are also stages that are designed to be a puzzle through use of mechanics such as levers to open and close passageways in a maze.

Each level is very unique compared to the rest and never once did I get the feeling that I played the same stage twice. This is rather impressive to me given the sheer number of levels put into the game. Straima achieves this through it's great variety of enemies, hazards, stage modifiers, and choice of power-ups. Utilizing the power-ups to the best of their ability is the key to completing each stage under the par time. When selecting a level, you are given the choice of picking one power-up out of a handful that pertain to the current stage being played. Sometimes, it is beneficial to use the slow-time power-up in order to dodge particularly difficult enemy fire; but is it worth using that over the ability to warp through the floor and potentially skip certain sections? I found these decisions to give a lot of weight to which power-up to choose when starting a stage. Through experimentation, you will learn the best application of each of these abilities.

There are two features that I didn't get around to using; a level editor and party play. The level editor offers the same tools that the developer used to create the core levels of the game. Created stages are able to be shared with others by downloading the file and placing it into their game folder. Unfortunately, it seems there is no community for this feature so right now even with a dedicated Steam sub-forum for user designs. As for the party play, it's local only and features a deathmatch mode for up to 4-players and a co-operative mode for 2-players. Most of the deathmatch stages are designed specifically for this mode whilst the co-operative mode shares stages with single-player.

Straima is definitely one of the better platformers that I've played in a long time. It's hard not to recommend a game that has such tight controls, varied level design, “one more” addictiveness, unique visuals, and great soundtrack. Keep in mind that even though it sounds like there is not a lot of content to be had with such short levels, it took me about 15 hours to achieve both trophies on all of the stages. If you're looking for a very challenging platforming experience, Straima is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995840140', 'num_games_owned': 3759, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1444374820}
review: I enjoyed playing this game. Pixel graphics, awesome music, colorful levels, great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037825100', 'num_games_owned': 3955, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1444165835}
review:
I gotta say I was really curious about this game and I wasn't left on my appetite.

This game makes me think of an old C-64 game called JumpMan but on Acid.

Really Original Game with Nice Pixel Graphics in Vivid Colors (probably too bright for some), Good Multiplayer Action and some Great 8bit Music to go with it. Add to that a Level Editor which I didn't touch but sounds like a great addon for anyone wanting to push the Gaming experience some more (maybe play mind tricks with your friends too).

The Downside for me was some missing information about Gameplay but already in the last week the Dev added a Tutorial Level which explains some basics, I wish he adds some more info to it like explaining the different super-powers you can pick from but nonetheless it's already a good step forward. 

Last Words, unless you're Epileptic or simply don't like Simple Pixel-Graphics games.. jump on this, especially if you see it on sale. It's a great cheap investment for Couch Co-op Fun !!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074044081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1480008006}
review:
this one is so simple but gorgeous at the same time: your basic task is to smash every jelly creature (looks like they enjoy it) you meet in the level. Sounds simple but yet it's so hard to reach the goal in time.

The graphics are crazy, with super pumped colours that keep punching your retina. The sprite design is lovely.

Also i found hella funny the settings menu

10/10 would do Asian Difficulty

author: {'steamid': '76561198073410742', 'num_games_owned': 7908, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1443543919}
review:
!!!WARNING!!! THIS GAME IS EXTREMELY HARD !!!WARNING!!!

Story: You are a hero and you need to kill those weird pinky things to complete the levels. THE END :D

Gameplay: I found this game extremely hard. There are over 100 levels, so you will easily destroy your keyboard/controller. It has co-op, so you can play with your friends which is really nice :D It also has level editor, so the community can create more levels (if the 100+ is not enough for you -.-). The main target of that game is to kill all those weird pink things and then go to next level and so on. You also have an optional target to complete the level without dying, which is hard as f**k.

Sound: The music is AWESOME !!! It is very minimalistic, but it is really awesome.

Graphic: It is pixel style one :D Also your eyes might start bleeding since it is very psychedelic :D 

Overall i recommend that game, but the in responsible price. If it is -75% take it without a doubt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111968405', 'num_games_owned': 2283, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1590316751}
review:
Straima is so wierd that Il jump straight on pros and cons ^^

+Challenging
+Awesome bit music
+Multiplayer and coop
+Level editor and several playable mods

-Uber overcolored 
-Small maps
-Small character and objects

Overall;
Recommended to platform lovers who are looking for challenging game, full potential and best fun is in coop^^ 
My personal opinion is that 8,99 is too much for this type of game, therefore I suggest waiting for 30%+ discount

author: {'steamid': '76561198106775983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1699852760}
review: very epic

author: {'steamid': '76561198008737053', 'num_games_owned': 5218, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1443466698}
review:
Straima is a interesting indie pixel graphic platfolmer where you should destroying a little "mucus". You should destroy all of them if you want finish a level and you have also another optional target, which mean you shouldn't die. A game really not easy and have more hundred levels. A game also have a coop up to 4 player and level editor. 

So my verdict

+many levels
+coop
+nice music
+colorful style
+level editor
+cards

-a bit hard
-not for everyone (not all people like minimalist pixel graphic style)
-a bit anoying menu
-a bit high price 

Overall: 6,5/10

I think its a game can be really enjoyable for that who like platformer games and don't afraid from pixel graphic style. A game have a good music, in coop you can earn a lot fun and if you want a challenge its game for you.
But if you not really fan of platformer games, but want its try, i recommend to you wait until game get a minimum 50% discount or going to bundle.
